page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: Public transport is almost non- existent in this area. A private firm runs a bus srvice once a week, which passes through{Bleasby Moor, West and {East Torrington,}on its way to Lincoln. It reaches Lincoln at 10.45am and leaves for the return journey at 2.15pm.{East and West Torrington} belong to the Barkwith Group of Parishes. The parish mini-bus is used to collect worshippers and choir on Sundays, and it collects the Over-60s for their monthly meetings.School buses collect primary-school aged children to take them to Legsby School, and secondary-school aged children to take them to De Aston School,Market Rasen. Apart from these, people must rely on private cars, including the volunteer Social Car Service,which will transport people for hospital appointments.
